javadoc:
A structure used by a {@link CliMetadataRoot} describe a {@link CliAbstractStream}.

Note that this type of "header" isn't found at the start of the stream, but as elements of a list of headers at the end of a {@link CliMetadataRoot}. They are kind of like PE section headers.

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Constructs a new CLI Stream Header datatype.

params.name: reader
params.comment: A binary reader set to start reading at the start of this header.

methods.javadoc:
Gets the {@link CliMetadataRoot} that contains us.
@return The {@link CliMetadataRoot} that contains us.
methods.name: getMetadataRoot
methods.comment: Gets the CliMetadataRoot that contains us.

methods.name: getStream
methods.comment: Gets the CliAbstractStream that this is a header for.

return.comment:
The CliAbstractStream that this is a header for.  Could be null if we
   don't support the stream type.

methods.name: getOffset
methods.comment:
Gets the offset.  This is not a file offset, but an offset that gets added to 
 the metadata header's offset to obtain a file offset.

methods.javadoc:
Gets the size of this header's stream.
@return The size of this header's stream.
methods.name: getSize
methods.comment: Gets the size of this header's stream.

return.comment: The size of this header's stream.

methods.javadoc:
Gets the name of this header's stream.
@return The name of this header's stream.
methods.name: getName
methods.comment: Gets the name of this header's stream.

return.comment: The name of this header's stream.

methods.javadoc:
Gets the name length.

The name length may be larger than necessary because the name string is must be aligned to the next 4-byte boundary. @return The name length.
methods.name: getNameLength
methods.comment:
Gets the name length.
 
 The name length may be larger than necessary because the name string is must
 be aligned to the next 4-byte boundary.

methods.javadoc:
Sets this header's stream.
@param stream The stream associated with this header.
methods.name: setStream

params.name: stream
params.comment: The stream associated with this header.

name: CliStreamHeader
comment:
A structure used by a CliMetadataRoot describe a CliAbstractStream.
 
 Note that this type of "header" isn't found at the start of the stream, but as
 elements of a list of headers at the end of a CliMetadataRoot.  They 
 are kind of like PE section headers.
